edu.uab.ssg.mixomatic.power

Interface BootstrapEstimator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultEstimator

    public interface BootstrapEstimator
    A bootstrap estimator of the proportions of interest: true positive (TP), true negative (TN), and expected discovery rate (EDR), described in the below paper.

    Gadbury GL, Page GP, Edwards J, Kayo T, Weindruch R, Permana PA, Mountz J, Allison DB. Power and Sample Size Estimation in High Dimensional Biology. Stat Meth Med Res 2004, 13:325-338.

    DOI: 10.1191/0962280204sm369ra

    Author:
    Jelai Wang

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  BootstrapEstimator.Configuration
      A bootstrap estimator configuration.
      static interface  BootstrapEstimator.Estimate
      The point and standard error estimates for TP, TN, and EDR.
      static interface  BootstrapEstimator.PValueAdjuster
      An algorithm for "adjusting" a p-value from a hypothesis test to an "adjusted" p-value that would have resulted from the same hypothesis test conducted at a different sample size.
      static interface  BootstrapEstimator.RandomNumberGenerator
      A random number generator that provides random numbers from the binomial, uniform, and beta distributions; required by the steps of the bootstrap estimation procedure described in the paper.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BootstrapEstimator.Estimate estimateProportions(MixtureModel.Estimate estimate, int N1, int N2, int n_, double significanceLevel)
      Estimates the proportions of interest: TP, TN, and EDR, at the user-specified sample size and significance level.
      BootstrapEstimator.Configuration getConfiguration()
      Returns the configuration.

    • Method Detail

      • estimateProportions

        BootstrapEstimator.Estimate estimateProportions(MixtureModel.Estimate estimate,
                                                int N1,
                                                int N2,
                                                int n_,
                                                double significanceLevel)
        Estimates the proportions of interest: TP, TN, and EDR, at the user-specified sample size and significance level. Assumes the client programmer has conducted many, valid two-group hypothesis tests to obtain a sample distribution of p-values, from those tests, and fitted a mixture model, using a MixtureModel.Estimator, to this distribution of p-values. If N1 != N2, then an equal group sample size, called n in the paper, is calculated and used in subsequent calculations.
        Parameters:
        estimate - The mixture model estimate.
        N1 - The sample size of the first group in the two-group hypothesis test.
        N2 - The sample size of the second group in the two-group hypothesis test.
        n_ - The sample size at which to calculate the estimates. Called n* in the paper.
        significanceLevel - The signficance level at which to calculate the estimates. Called threshold τ in the paper.

      • getConfiguration

        BootstrapEstimator.Configuration getConfiguration()
        Returns the configuration.
